alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; South Central Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 15 at 2:14AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Snow moving through northern and central Nevada today... A storm system is bringing a band of light to at times moderate snow to Nevada today. This band of snow will move across the I-80 corridor from west to east reaching Wells before sunrise. Expect less than one inch along roadways in northern Nevada through mid- morning with up to an inch along higher passes. Motorists should remain alert to rapidly changing weather, and take necessary precautions if travel is necessary as slick spots can develop quickly at night along with poor visibility. Precipitation will move into central Nevada by late morning. Motorists should remain alert to rapidly changing weather, and take necessary precautions if travel is necessary. North winds behind a cold front will remain elevated through this afternoon across portions of the state before subsiding tonight. Wind speeds will be in the 15-20 mph range with higher gusts. Areas of blowing and drifting snow are possible, especially on higher passes and summits. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
